edge: Pia's parents want her to be admitted to Delhi Grammar School as they believe it will enable her to become a part of elite society.
In order to be admitted, students at Delhi Grammar School must stay within a 3-km radius of the school.
Pia's parents want her to be admitted to a prestigious English-medium school in Delhi because they believe it will enable her to become a part of elite society.
Despite her misgivings about them, Saumya tutors Pia's parents in the answers to be given in the admission interview.

Shyam and Tulsi teach Raj and Meeta to live like truly poor people, and Raj joins Shyam at work. However, while Pia eventually gets admitted to Delhi Grammar School, Mohan is still hopeful that he will be admitted through the RTE quota.

After moving to Bharat Nagar, a slum area, Raj and Meeta learn from an employee that his daughter has been admitted through the RTE quota, a scheme that helps children from poor families to be admitted to prestigious schools. They move to Bharat Nagar for a month and pretend to be poor.
